name: Lamb Madras
history: Lamb Madras is a popular Indian curry dish that originated in the southern region of India, particularly in Madras (now Chennai). Known for its rich and fiery flavor, it has become a favorite in Indian cuisine globally.
description: Lamb Madras is a spicy and flavorful curry made with tender pieces of lamb, cooked in a tangy and hot sauce. It typically includes a blend of spices like cumin, coriander, mustard seeds, and chili, offering a deep, complex flavor.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Spices and Onions
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Once they splutter, add onions and cook until golden. Stir in ginger-garlic paste.

instructions.title: Add Dry Spices
instructions.description: Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook the spices for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Cook the Lamb
instructions.description: Add lamb pieces to the pan. Cook until they start to brown.

instructions.title: Simmer with Tomatoes and Tamarind
instructions.description: Add chopped tomatoes and tamarind paste. Cover and cook until the lamb is tender, adding water as necessary.

instructions.title: Finish with Coconut Milk and Garam Masala
instructions.description: Add coconut milk and garam masala. Simmer for an additional 10 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian breads like naan or paratha.

tips: Adjust the amount of red chili powder and green chilies to suit your spice preference.
Ensure the lamb is well-cooked and tender before adding the coconut milk.
variations: Add vegetables like bell peppers or potatoes for a more hearty curry.
Use yogurt instead of coconut milk for a tangier flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat gently on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish, garnished with a lemon wedge.
Pair with a cooling side dish like cucumber raita.
